item.title: Re: BLIND FURY ALLIES
item.content:encoded:
Minor corrections to MRUhlir's otherwise on the dot suggestions:

If you're using Lucky Sevens, you don't need to use Ichi Ramen.
In place of Lucky Sevens, you could use a Monochrome Pheromone instead.
The -30 stamina jutsu are +10 range, not +3.
Ochre Potion is +1 range that day in regular missions, Powerful Potion is +3 strength on the next regular mission.
If you don't need jutsu to be able to pass the mission, and don't have Lucky Sevens theme or Monochrome Pheromone to use, you can try using Kido: I Can Has Cheezburger.

item.title: Re: BLIND FURY ALLIES
item.content:encoded:
Sighâ€¦you don't need someone to hold your hand - you are smart enough to figure it out on your own. And it all depends on your specific stats anyway, and without knowing those it's impossible to say what is 100% the best.

Use the mission calculator under guides to see how different teams/jutsu/ect help you.

Some basic rules of thumb - Shikai is almost always better then Bankai for high difficulty missions. Don't use crank because you don't get any significant bonus from it. Use 'Stand By' or 'Lucky Sevens' theme and use Ichi Ramen. The +3 str +3 range -30 stam jutsus are almost always the best way to go. Use a Jet Black Potion(+ 5 lvls) and/or an Ochre Potion(+3 str) if you still have a low chance of success with the best team/jutsu combination you can find.
